e3bba812-a3a0-4072-b72c-9a414c8903b3.content: {Practical wisdom is required to appropriately apply virtues in varied contexts.}, {Practical wisdom is a supplementary trait that allows individuals to balance virtues with situational demands.}, {With practical wisdom, honesty can be balanced against other virtues like kindness and discretion.}, {Practical wisdom provides the ability to discern when the expression of a trait like honesty is warranted.}

063a721d-a5d1-4b9b-b2b5-a9d06fdf2e67.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues require genuine character development}, {Genuine character development cannot be achieved through technological or psychological interventions}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

c6787492-143e-4b56-a048-a39849b3841d.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues require an understanding of moral principles}, {Understanding of moral principles cannot be instilled by external manipulation}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

3adf68f9-1757-492b-9499-6065faaf0997.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues require the autonomous development of moral character}, {Autonomous moral character development cannot be undermined by external control}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

36564ef6-9415-4f44-bdb1-f3027bff2217.summary: Virtue as an Expression of Moral Integrity
36564ef6-9415-4f44-bdb1-f3027bff2217.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues are expressions of internal moral integrity}, {Internal moral integrity cannot be artificially instilled}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

a930a3af-4dff-4275-b06c-aa506056a658.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues must be motivated by internal moral reasoning}, {Internal moral reasoning cannot be substituted by external influences}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

b20be6d7-abfb-49a3-b190-aa306064f793.summary: Distinguishing genuine development from artificial manipulation
b20be6d7-abfb-49a3-b190-aa306064f793.content: {There is a distinction between genuine development of virtues and artificially induced behaviors}, {Genuine virtue involves personal growth and understanding, which cannot be instilled through external manipulation}, {Artificial influence may produce behaviors resembling virtue, but lacks the underlying character traits essential to true virtue}

f1767fb9-2a51-48fc-adc9-231bb3e3c7bd.summary: Rejecting behavioral equivalence as genuine virtue
f1767fb9-2a51-48fc-adc9-231bb3e3c7bd.content: {It is a mistake to equate consistent virtuous actions resulting from manipulation with genuine virtue}, {True virtue requires internal endorsement and reflection, not merely external behavior alignment}, {Manipulated dispositions, therefore, do not fulfill the criteria of true virtues, as they lack authenticity and personal integrity}

5e3c87b8-fadc-4df9-896b-587d4ee2a9b3.summary: Supplementing virtue theory with an authenticity condition
5e3c87b8-fadc-4df9-896b-587d4ee2a9b3.content: {A new criterion for virtue requires it not only to be a stable disposition but also to be authentically connected to one's character}, {Authentic virtues must originate from and be endorsed by the individual's own values and understandings}, {This additional requirement excludes manipulated dispositions from counting as genuine virtues, resolving concerns about authenticity}

695d3bce-d929-4fb5-9015-cad5d2370e3d.summary: Virtue as Disposition with Internal Motivation
695d3bce-d929-4fb5-9015-cad5d2370e3d.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtue includes an internal motivation to act}, {Virtues can exist even if external actions are thwarted}

cae8752b-c665-4e5c-a537-3ed56e649283.summary: Virtue as Disposition with Contextual Flexibility
cae8752b-c665-4e5c-a537-3ed56e649283.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues influence actions when context allows}, {Virtues can persist without immediate external manifestation}

8b8410da-f413-496d-81d8-ede873ddaa18.summary: Virtue as Disposition towards Personal Growth
8b8410da-f413-496d-81d8-ede873ddaa18.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues contribute to personal development over time}, {Virtues promote inner growth regardless of external actions}

4c634cf8-d909-40c8-b3be-e02c1f55be46.content: {Virtue is the potential to act virtuously}, {Potential is a stable trait of character}, {Virtue includes preparation for future action}, {Virtue is not negated by lack of immediate action}

40afd105-6dfd-4872-832f-f06770851920.summary: Virtue as Disposition with Emotional Regulation
40afd105-6dfd-4872-832f-f06770851920.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues regulate emotions even without external action}, {Virtues are efficacious internally despite external inaction}

33d2fe72-2ec6-4edb-b17b-839a42a5591d.summary: Distinguishing between dispositional and conditional virtues
33d2fe72-2ec6-4edb-b17b-839a42a5591d.content: {There is a distinction between dispositional virtues and conditional virtues}, {Dispositional virtues refer to stable traits of character irrespective of external circumstances}, {Conditional virtues require not just internal disposition but an opportunity for action}, {Virtues as a disposition can exist independently of resulting actions due to external circumstances}

c5324a91-7625-4730-bf06-9084d3cf815c.summary: Rejecting the necessity of action for virtue
c5324a91-7625-4730-bf06-9084d3cf815c.content: {The claim that a virtue must result in action to be considered a virtue is false}, {A virtuous disposition remains a virtue even if external factors prevent action}, {Virtue is primarily assessed by the quality and stability of the character trait, not by the frequency of actions}

dd521a81-6e2e-4930-bfbd-cd0128cec0ea.summary: Explaining the effect of virtues on internal states
dd521a81-6e2e-4930-bfbd-cd0128cec0ea.content: {Virtues can influence internal emotional states even without resulting in external actions}, {The efficacy of a virtue can be measured by its regulation of emotions and intentions}, {Virtues may manifest in internal developments or states rather than observable actions}

beb40db1-2556-4a78-bf7d-22ab62c95583.summary: Virtue as Disposition to Act and Think
beb40db1-2556-4a78-bf7d-22ab62c95583.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions, emotions, and thoughts}

312d6f65-d0bb-42e7-af0a-c435a1188b11.content: {Virtue is an integrated disposition}, {An integrated disposition includes stable traits involving both action and contemplation}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and informed thinking}

2c775738-9d0e-4320-8fde-7278e2c47cdf.content: {Virtue is a dual disposition}, {A dual disposition encompasses stable traits involving actions and contemplative reasoning}, {Virtues can result in appropriate actions or informed contemplation}

4886e233-de66-4aca-9e92-f6430b34fe80.summary: Virtue as Disposition Towards Practical and Theoretical Wisdom
4886e233-de66-4aca-9e92-f6430b34fe80.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues lead to practical wisdom involving actions}, {Virtues lead to theoretical wisdom involving contemplation}

fe4c8d72-f0be-4a89-879d-b48ee73fc1e8.content: {Virtue is a comprehensive disposition}, {A comprehensive disposition is a stable character trait that involves actions, emotions, and thoughts}, {Virtues encompass both practical actions and informed introspection}

6618c578-6284-43d3-a2a3-02a84588a1ee.summary: Distinguishing between action and contemplation-based virtues
6618c578-6284-43d3-a2a3-02a84588a1ee.content: {There is a distinction between virtues that lead directly to actions and those that involve contemplation and thought}, {Virtue as disposition to act focuses on character traits that result in actions or readiness for action}, {Contemplative virtues can still be seen as underpinning appropriate actions indirectly through informed decision-making}, {Wisdom involves contemplation but it informs actions by shaping judgments and guiding decisions}

18e582bf-2ae7-4dcd-a585-ffcb3bce10ea.content: {The definition of "action" can include internal actions like decision-making and judgment, not just physical acts}, {Wisdom, as a virtue, involves the internal action of making informed and wise decisions}, {Internal actions such as informed thinking are critical in guiding external actions}, {When considering virtues, both internal actions and external actions should be recognized as vital}

7c6d40ef-6ad6-4427-83f5-2775abf3a254.summary: Emphasizing the supplementary role of contemplation in virtue
7c6d40ef-6ad6-4427-83f5-2775abf3a254.content: {Contemplation plays a supplementary role in the exercise of virtues that lead to appropriate actions}, {Virtue as disposition encompasses both contemplation when it informs or results in actions eventually}, {When wisdom contributes to decisions or shapes actions through contemplation, it aligns with the virtue-as-disposition perspective}, {Contemplative virtues contribute to a disposition to act appropriately by ensuring that actions are based on thoughtful deliberation}

0cd31d99-7dd2-4dee-9fe8-8116ef5f19b9.summary: Rejecting the notion that wisdom lacks action-oriented elements
0cd31d99-7dd2-4dee-9fe8-8116ef5f19b9.content: {It is mistaken to claim that wisdom lacks an action-oriented component}, {Wisdom includes the ability to make sound judgments and decisions in action-related contexts}, {The contemplative aspect of wisdom enhances the quality of actions by offering clarity and understanding}, {Even though wisdom primarily involves thought, its ultimate role is to guide actions effectively}

1bfd636c-c00a-4859-9800-838361bec67a.summary: Virtue as Disposition to Act with Genuine Emotions
1bfd636c-c00a-4859-9800-838361bec67a.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions when supported by genuine emotions}

3cdd42ed-c970-411c-963f-f0419ae5ef3b.summary: Virtue as Disposition with Emotion Regulation
3cdd42ed-c970-411c-963f-f0419ae5ef3b.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions}, {Virtues include the regulation of emotions to align with actions}

4ec75268-a40b-4f6c-8413-c172900330c1.summary: Virtue as Disposition with Intentional Emotion Alignment
4ec75268-a40b-4f6c-8413-c172900330c1.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues entail intentional alignment of emotions with actions}

dcbf7776-1617-4a30-88bd-b291238a5b66.summary: Virtue as Characteristic Commitment to Self-Improving Emotion
dcbf7776-1617-4a30-88bd-b291238a5b66.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues involve a commitment to aligning emotions with ethical ideals over time}

cf8f54e6-36ac-4f01-99d2-4177f2a68e56.summary: Virtue as Disposition for Consistent Emotional Cultivation
cf8f54e6-36ac-4f01-99d2-4177f2a68e56.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues include ongoing cultivation of emotions to reflect virtuous actions}

18c3b3fe-d6ba-4ee0-a480-707fb0e99560.summary: Virtue as Disposition to Prioritize Ethical Emotions
18c3b3fe-d6ba-4ee0-a480-707fb0e99560.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues require prioritizing emotions that align with ethical actions}

bf2289db-4a8d-4a20-89cc-f208009fcf4a.summary: Virtue as Disposition in Harmonizing Action and Emotion
bf2289db-4a8d-4a20-89cc-f208009fcf4a.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues are characterized by harmonizing actions and emotions in ethical contexts}

18af9e2c-2ca1-4477-bb5b-95ba5231b28c.summary: Virtue as Disposition to Develop Emotional Sensitivity
18af9e2c-2ca1-4477-bb5b-95ba5231b28c.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues include the development of emotional sensitivity consistent with moral principles}

527b0035-68a4-41a0-a5ec-a8034a6d242b.summary: Virtue as Disposition to Foster Emotional Integrity
527b0035-68a4-41a0-a5ec-a8034a6d242b.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues require fostering emotional integrity that supports virtuous behavior}

e8c05937-46c3-406c-85f6-a91c7766c983.summary: Distinguishing between action and emotion alignment
e8c05937-46c3-406c-85f6-a91c7766c983.content: {There is a distinction between actions that align with virtue and emotions that align with virtue}, {Virtue as a disposition concerns primarily the alignment of actions with virtuous traits rather than the alignment of emotions}, {Experiencing conflicting emotions does not necessarily negate the presence of virtue, as long as actions are consistent with virtuous dispositions}, {Emotional alignment, while ideal, is supplementary to virtuous action in demonstrating virtue}

e1286905-9c3a-46f1-8085-6fec961ebab3.summary: Rejecting necessity of emotional alignment for virtue
e1286905-9c3a-46f1-8085-6fec961ebab3.content: {It is false that emotional alignment is necessary for demonstrating virtue through action}, {Virtue as a disposition primarily concerns itself with character traits that lead to right actions}, {A person can possess virtue even if conflicting emotions arise, provided that their actions consistently align with virtuous motives}

a7d7ab57-2c52-4932-8a64-50eebdadea62.summary: Supplementing with the gradual alignment process
a7d7ab57-2c52-4932-8a64-50eebdadea62.content: {Emotional alignment with virtuous actions is viewed as a developmental process}, {Virtue as a disposition allows for the gradual alignment of emotions over time as one practices virtuous actions}, {The presence of conflicting emotions does not undermine virtue but indicates an ongoing process of moral growth}

2b2170c2-333d-41f3-bb24-6c51956ee00e.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues can manifest differently depending on situational contexts}, {Situational contexts play a role in how virtues lead to actions}

7a7e0074-329a-4b02-a101-4a489a19f57e.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues incorporate an awareness of situational demands}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions by considering both stable traits and situational factors}

cdf2b7e9-5744-4a72-aa9c-da52b6553b5b.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a stable trait of character}, {Virtues include adaptability to situational influences}, {Virtues lead to actions that are sensitive to both character and situational factors}

9c97f547-6895-45a9-8dc6-6f2de7a2b721.summary: Distinguishing between intrinsic and extrinsic influences
9c97f547-6895-45a9-8dc6-6f2de7a2b721.content: {There is a distinction between intrinsic traits and extrinsic influences that affect behavior}, {Virtue as a disposition concerns intrinsic character traits rather than the situational factors that might influence behavior}, {External pressures do not necessarily overturn the stable intrinsic traits but rather situationally impact their expression}, {Situational variability doesn't negate the existence of stable virtues, as virtues can coexist with external influencing factors}

cbf940d7-3f7e-4525-a487-b16acb382402.summary: Rejecting the claim of complete override by situations
cbf940d7-3f7e-4525-a487-b16acb382402.content: {It is false that external pressures completely override stable character traits}, {Virtue is still present even if situational factors affect behavior, as virtues are measured by tendencies across contexts, not absolute consistency}, {The idea that virtues always lead to the same actions is mistaken; instead, they guide actions within the bounds of situational constraints}, {The interaction between virtue and situational factors shows the adaptability of virtue, not its absence or invalidation}

c0ea6fa9-116a-48ac-9246-a76765bbf15e.summary: Supplementing with resilience to situational factors
c0ea6fa9-116a-48ac-9246-a76765bbf15e.content: {Virtues include a resilience aspect that allows individuals to act virtuously despite adverse conditions}, {This resilience works as a supplementary trait enhancing the person's ability to uphold virtues despite challenging situational factors}, {The influence of resilience means that in many cases, virtues will still lead to appropriate actions even under pressure}, {This resilience supplements the core idea of virtue as a stable trait, providing an expanded understanding that accounts for external pressure}

1652300e-71e8-4667-8eae-4233bd9b840f.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a trait of character that can develop over time}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

09ea51d8-831c-430f-963e-885fc78b9a7e.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition accommodates growth and change in character}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

830be464-c0b3-41a4-8440-72dd664a821b.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition is a dynamic trait that responds to new experiences and learning}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

eaf0097e-0f21-4303-ac38-39babcfe3671.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition may change according to situational contexts and personal development}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

db9383ac-b650-48b9-98a2-f06ee97b7d84.content: {Virtue is a disposition}, {A disposition can adapt to new circumstances and personal growth}, {Virtues lead to appropriate actions and emotions}

ecf2614f-3615-42b6-9b0e-68c49cb34440.summary: Distinguishing between stability and flexibility in disposition
ecf2614f-3615-42b6-9b0e-68c49cb34440.content: {There is a distinction between stability and rigidity in the concept of traits}, {Virtue as a disposition refers to a stable tendency to act in certain ways, but allows for flexibility and adaptation over time}, {Stability in virtue does not exclude the possibility of growth and development in response to new experiences}

1b14f29b-e738-449e-a5b9-4431f41d35ff.summary: Rejecting the notion of stability as static immutability
1b14f29b-e738-449e-a5b9-4431f41d35ff.content: {It is mistaken to interpret stability in traits as implying static immutability}, {Stability refers to the consistent presence of a trait across varying circumstances, rather than its resistance to any change}, {The development of new virtues through learning is compatible with the ongoing stability of an underlying virtuous character}

018ba729-f2f7-41ec-80d9-983b9d302009.summary: Supplementing with the concept of narrative identity
018ba729-f2f7-41ec-80d9-983b9d302009.content: {The concept of narrative identity allows for the integration of new virtues into an individual's character}, {Narrative identity provides a coherent framework in which traits can evolve while maintaining overall character stability}, {This perspective accommodates changes in virtues as part of an individual's broader life story}

f3a17353-2ccb-4458-8337-7f23a020959d.content: {Virtue is characterized by having a balanced disposition}, {The balance is not strictly mathematical but practical}, {Each virtue involves having the right feeling or action at the right time, for the right reason, in the right way}

2c3d7a17-5294-4c2a-8e42-9089f6a335a4.content: {Virtue is acting appropriately according to the context}, {Appropriateness is determined by a wise understanding of particular situations}, {Virtue is manifested through actions that best suit each unique circumstance}

3c11dc33-601f-4678-bd38-2e31f96e6853.content: {Virtue is a state of inner harmony and unity}, {This harmony involves a coherent alignment of thoughts, feelings, and actions}, {Virtue requires a balanced integration of emotional responses and rational judgments}

6742b88b-95fc-44b4-8370-3fe179d673b1.content: {Virtue is the excellent fulfillment of a function}, {Each virtue corresponds to an excellence in performing particular human functions}, {Virtue involves both rational and emotional faculties working optimally}

971679f9-9190-4029-bb59-57d6a6a75ece.content: {Virtue consists in practical wisdom guiding actions}, {The moral value of actions is judged by their outcomes and adaptability}, {Virtuous action requires flexible problem-solving within ethical parameters}

cb064c85-534b-460b-9fcb-2fdcca13027c.content: {Virtue is primarily about emotional intelligence and awareness}, {Understanding one's emotions and those of others is key to virtue}, {Virtuous behavior stems from effectively managing and guiding emotional responses}

17f3f72f-d178-4dd5-b9c2-22205a4dbf5b.content: {Virtue is a process of moral development and growth}, {Virtue involves the cultivation of moral character over time}, {Development of virtues occurs through experiences that foster learning and improvement}

943e6083-9057-4f7f-b164-255500e64a11.content: {Virtue is about acting in rationally appropriate ways}, {Rationality guides the assessment of what is virtuous}, {The appropriateness of virtuous acts is determined by logical evaluation of contexts}

13bee07e-6b0a-4066-8eab-c51ce98bc260.summary: Distinguishing between virtues with clear excess and deficiency
13bee07e-6b0a-4066-8eab-c51ce98bc260.content: {There is a distinction between virtues that clearly have excess and deficiency and those that do not.}, {Virtue as the mean applies to virtues that involve clear and recognizable excesses and deficiencies.}, {Certain virtues like charity can be understood better through other aspects of virtuous behavior rather than through the mean.}, {The concept of mean in virtues is primarily applicable to character traits with clear opposites.}

bf926344-18c9-47a4-a9b9-5932afc2deb1.content: {The mean in virtue is determined not solely by mathematical balance but by what is contextually appropriate.}, {Virtue involves the right action in the right context, even if it does not appear as a middle ground.}, {The emphasis is on context-sensitive judgment more than on symmetry of excess and deficiency.}, {Charity and loyalty require contextual wisdom in their practice rather than a strict adherence to a mean.}

af1a6961-eb12-4417-858f-c9adfc8bede7.summary: Rejecting the uniqueness of the middle ground challenge
af1a6961-eb12-4417-858f-c9adfc8bede7.content: {It is mistaken to assume that the mean is uniquely defined in a simplistic middle point.}, {Virtue as the mean encompasses a range of behaviors appropriate to varying situations.}, {A moderately courageous person failing to act can be seen as lacking virtue due not to the concept of mean but due to a failure of situational appropriateness.}, {Virtues exhibit flexibility across circumstances rather than rigid adherence to a single middle ground.}

5b2cf500-e38a-48ea-8864-cd3285cf3245.summary: Explaining virtues through the spectrum of contextual nuances
5b2cf500-e38a-48ea-8864-cd3285cf3245.content: {The apparent lack of excess and deficiency in certain virtues is explained by their position in a nuanced spectrum of behaviors.}, {Virtues like loyalty involve a range of actions that are contextually determined, not easily encapsulated by a fixed mean.}, {The perception of balance in virtues needs to incorporate contextual subtleties beyond rigid excess and deficiency.}, {Virtue as the mean involves understanding the complex spectrum of human behavior and ethical challenges.}

80e1fbff-3bee-484d-a8fb-c177d825b71f.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by a wise and virtuous person through practical wisdom}, {Practical wisdom enables one to discern the appropriate action in varying contexts}

1d5f4d72-9767-43ad-aed6-469f0f344c44.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {Moral rules provide specific guidelines to approximate the mean in different situations}, {These rules are derived from observing patterns of virtuous behavior in exemplary individuals}

d305f914-5c9a-42e1-9611-9dad0c1a97f0.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {The mean is understood contextually in each unique situation}, {The mean considers the particular relationships and circumstances present}

ab407052-e723-42fc-9193-735038f2a0dc.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {Moral education shapes one's ability to intuitively discern the mean}, {Intuition is honed through experience and reflection over time}

8837f5c5-59ab-48ef-b889-485b82e5dcb2.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {Objective criteria are established to assess the mean for specific virtues}, {These criteria are based on empirical studies of outcomes associated with virtuous actions}

82c9cda3-f7ba-4ea9-a6ef-d7cebeb29735.summary: Distinguishing between different types of precision
82c9cda3-f7ba-4ea9-a6ef-d7cebeb29735.content: {Precision in moral theory may be different from precision in mathematics}, {The concept of the mean in virtue ethics is not meant to provide exact numerical guidance but to offer a flexible framework for moral reasoning}, {The relative nature of the mean allows individuals to apply moral principles appropriately to their specific contexts}, {The variability of what constitutes the mean reflects the complexity of human life rather than a defect in the theory itself}

db69dcee-37f8-49a4-a169-5125cb2ce968.summary: Rejection of the need for precise guidance
db69dcee-37f8-49a4-a169-5125cb2ce968.content: {It is false that moral guidance must always be precise and unambiguous}, {Moral excellence often requires practical wisdom, which involves discernment rather than rigid rule-following}, {The ability to respond to fluctuating situations is a strength of virtue ethics, not a weakness}, {Virtue is about developing character over time, which includes learning to judge what the mean is in varied contexts}

4c853314-49dc-4015-861c-a022da427f25.content: {Practical wisdom (phronesis) is a necessary supplement to the concept of virtue as the mean}, {Practical wisdom enables individuals to determine the appropriate mean relative to the specifics of each situation}, {Possessing practical wisdom implies the ability to act decisively, even in emergencies, by rapidly identifying the mean}, {Virtue ethics emphasizes the development of character traits that include quick, informed decision-making}

6eed895d-d881-448f-b6e6-7ec1b4805bed.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by objective standards rather than individual relativity}

03f8382a-ae4d-4568-ae94-1146067afecc.summary: Virtue as a Mean with Universalizable Standards
03f8382a-ae4d-4568-ae94-1146067afecc.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {Universal moral principles determine the mean, providing consistent guidance for everyone}

212e5803-2f00-4023-a8f5-dab9103d51c3.summary: Virtue as a Mean Guided by an Ideal Observer
212e5803-2f00-4023-a8f5-dab9103d51c3.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by what an ideal observer, possessing perfect rationality and full information, would judge}

2314c395-fcc2-4dc2-b476-fb4554b23932.summary: Virtue as a Mean with Cultural Norms
2314c395-fcc2-4dc2-b476-fb4554b23932.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by widely accepted cultural or societal norms}

409e5f71-7cf6-43ff-a692-4e9310f4da9c.summary: Virtue as a Mean Linked to Human Flourishing
409e5f71-7cf6-43ff-a692-4e9310f4da9c.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {The mean is evaluated based on its contribution to human flourishing and well-being}

0f6a7131-39bf-40c0-9b7c-7e2662226a9f.summary: Distinguishing between subjective relativity and objective guidelines
0f6a7131-39bf-40c0-9b7c-7e2662226a9f.content: {There is a distinction between subjective relativity and objective guidelines in assessing virtue.}, {Virtue as the mean takes into account objective considerations about human well-being that inform what the mean is.}, {The idea of virtue being relative to us includes consideration of universal aspects of human nature and circumstances.}, {Despite relativity, virtues still provide sufficiently stable and objective guidance.}

7b19395d-526b-47df-a025-755f9bd3dbbf.summary: Rejecting the inference to subjective arbitrariness
7b19395d-526b-47df-a025-755f9bd3dbbf.content: {It is false that relativity entails subjective arbitrariness in judgments of virtue.}, {People with distorted moral perspectives do not represent the proper understanding of virtue.}, {The relativity acknowledged by virtue ethics remains consistent with the objective features of flourishing human life.}

59201f0b-ab87-4d62-b86c-cda9242e1a7e.summary: Clarifying the role of practical wisdom in applying virtue
59201f0b-ab87-4d62-b86c-cda9242e1a7e.content: {Practical wisdom is required to determine the mean in any given context.}, {Practical wisdom involves sensitivity to the demands of particular situations informed by a general understanding of human flourishing.}, {Practical wisdom prevents the subjective misuse of virtue ethics by prioritizing the right aims and perceptions of good.}

9c0be208-b407-4d86-890c-669910758f03.summary: Supplementing virtue ethics with a focus on human flourishing
9c0be208-b407-4d86-890c-669910758f03.content: {Virtue ethics can be supplemented with the assumption that virtues contribute to a stable conception of human flourishing.}, {Human flourishing provides a basis for evaluating actions beyond mere relativity to individual circumstances.}, {The mean reflects universal human conditions while acknowledging personal variations.}

8897fbed-bdb1-4ba9-b9ea-0ec6e742d2f8.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by the context of the situation}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices that may vary by context}

6098ab26-2264-4c55-bc8f-186f4358d3cb.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by the particular circumstances and needs of the situation}, {Virtues are flexible and may sometimes require extremes to achieve moral ends}

eec5451f-e310-4cab-8c0c-34b18170fd10.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by multiple dimensions including context, intent, and consequences}, {Each virtue operates on a spectrum influenced by various situational factors}

d796f55e-e946-4661-91da-45db4999be1e.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {Magnitude of a virtue can vary depending on the needs of a situation}, {In some contexts, greater magnitudes may be necessary for a virtue to fulfill its role}

a4809334-bc44-4d9f-b798-4c7b25801131.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency in general}, {Certain virtues may require extreme expressions in specific righteous scenarios}, {The mean is adjusted based on moral and practical demands of the circumstances}

5dc49b49-f582-4392-89ac-e8c89244a8b0.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined through the relationships and roles of individuals}, {The expression of virtue depends on relational contexts which may justify extremes}

b5c4b5ff-4ad1-4315-a778-203079578d12.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is a dynamic equilibrium constantly adjusted based on context and feedback}, {Each virtue responds flexibly to changing moral and situational landscapes}

1c47a543-d46e-44ae-acce-dfc8b1a44c8e.summary: Zeal as the mean between indifference and fanaticism
1c47a543-d46e-44ae-acce-dfc8b1a44c8e.content: {Virtue as the mean can encompass seemingly extreme virtues like zeal by identifying the relevant excess and deficiency as fanaticism and indifference.}, {Intensity in a virtue like zeal can still be a balanced mean when compared to a relative deficiency or excess in the context of a specific situation.}, {Being fully dedicated can be understood as the appropriate mean rather than extreme when it aligns with reason and the situation.}

d90a7a25-f37f-4ea6-a409-6b76f1934c64.summary: Relativity of the mean to individual and context
d90a7a25-f37f-4ea6-a409-6b76f1934c64.content: {The mean is always relative to us and considers the individual's nature and the situational context.}, {When dedication or zeal appears extreme, it might actually represent the mean relative to that person and that situation.}, {Virtues that appear extreme can still be considered the mean when tailored to the specific demands and abilities of the individual.}

63188bdc-dc60-4683-94f0-7e49e971f301.summary: Redefining virtues as relational rather than absolute
63188bdc-dc60-4683-94f0-7e49e971f301.content: {Virtues are not absolute in their expression but relational to the circumstances and the individual.}, {An intense expression of a virtue does not inherently mean extremity or excess.}, {What counts as a mean for virtues like dedication can be redefined based on the relationship to specific circumstances and the individual involved.}

99a3203d-6e36-4921-8884-455cb862f4d6.content: {The mean for virtues like dedication or zeal can include necessary intensity when the context demands it.}, {Situations that require full dedication can define the mean by the needs of the cause rather than a strict quantitative balance.}, {The concept of a mean incorporates the proportionality required by the duty or undertaking in question.}

3aa974e4-ab00-4b84-a8b2-58f1ff3d2b1b.content: {Virtue is defined by its stability across varying contexts}, {The mean is influenced by objective situational factors as well as individual differences}, {Each virtue maintains consistency by balancing the demands of different situations}

450f10a6-7569-420e-9701-bc3f4cd48962.content: {Virtue constitutes an objective ideal that transcends personal circumstances}, {The mean is determined by universal moral standards rather than individual assessment}, {Each virtue is represented by a constant ideal towards which individuals strive}

b1b0a0dd-f4f0-447c-a939-9afd929db0a8.content: {Virtue is defined by an integrated character that adapts without losing its core qualities}, {The mean involves a harmonious integration of stable traits and adaptive responses}, {Each virtue involves a commitment to a core value that guides actions across situations}

d42b00c4-0dc6-4f26-8c79-919f4f5aa497.content: {Virtue is conceptualized as a robust disposition towards balanced responses}, {The mean is a dispositional aim that guides consistent moral behavior}, {Each virtue is an enduring disposition that aligns with enduring life values}

ad993175-f8ff-4327-9d27-e3724838a0d6.content: {Virtue is expressed through excellence in fulfilling social roles responsibly}, {The mean corresponds to role-specific standards that remain consistent}, {Each virtue involves adherence to role-based ethical commitments}

267c0bca-1147-4d44-ac3c-c262f6648a6e.content: {Virtue involves rational consistency in moral judgment regardless of changing circumstances}, {The mean is determined by rational principles that do not fluctuate}, {Each virtue is defined by adherence to rational insights into moral truth}

80a2bbaf-02e5-4944-8e07-8359dff074a0.content: {Virtue is a reflection of unwavering moral integrity regardless of varying conditions}, {The mean represents actions that stem from intrinsic moral principles}, {Each virtue preserves moral integrity across different contexts}

6a7b1d4c-9b44-42bd-bcd2-60957aa5d9bb.summary: Clarifying the relativity of the mean
6a7b1d4c-9b44-42bd-bcd2-60957aa5d9bb.content: {The relativity of the mean is to individuals and circumstances; it reflects practical wisdom in varying contexts.}, {The stable aspect of virtue lies in its goal-directed nature toward the mean, guided by reason and understanding.}, {Shifts in the mean do not undermine virtue but affirm its adaptability and practical applicability across varying situations.}, {Virtue involves a consistent disposition guided by rational assessment rather than a fixed numerical midpoint.}

c042ca19-a44f-45b7-ba22-8154ffa7d162.content: {The variability of the mean does not imply instability because virtue requires a stable disposition to reason correctly in differing contexts.}, {The perceived instability comes from misunderstanding that virtue navigates circumstances rather than changes with them.}, {A virtuous person is one whose judgments remain consistently well-founded, even if specific actions vary.}

ea2db0a3-52d9-46ce-bd61-e8a654623bd1.content: {Practical wisdom, or phronesis, acts as a supplementary assumption guiding the determination of the mean.}, {Practical wisdom provides the consistent framework within which the mean can adapt to new circumstances.}, {This role of practical wisdom ensures stability in character by aligning actions with a rational understanding of virtue.}

ae2c66f5-f89c-43d5-972c-b39906283b4e.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by rational principles}, {Each virtue has objective standards beyond cultural differences}

6bc1dba8-79e3-4fc1-bf9e-338958e6cb03.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relative to the nature of human beings}, {Each virtue has innate human tendencies as reference points}

d00e15d3-df8c-47cc-83e6-befe4a395fc3.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relative to cultural contexts}, {Each virtue is understood through a cultural lens while having universal features}

7853abb2-3dae-44d1-919f-c90f8c27b077.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by the perspective of an ideal rational observer}, {Each virtue is assessed through the viewpoint of a fully informed, rational evaluator}

d3b5cc34-4100-4b8d-805c-c74d70e5658a.summary: Practical Reason as a Guide to Virtue
d3b5cc34-4100-4b8d-805c-c74d70e5658a.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is found through the exercise of practical reason}, {Each virtue aligns with the reasoned judgment of a practically wise person}

a9097ef0-b77d-45ea-a442-5c662ef24e9e.summary: Distinguishing between universal principles and cultural applications
a9097ef0-b77d-45ea-a442-5c662ef24e9e.content: {There is a distinction between the universal structure of virtues and their specific cultural manifestations}, {Virtue as the mean can be a universal principle even if its application varies by culture}, {The mean between excess and deficiency can be understood differently in diverse cultural contexts, without undermining the concept of virtue as the mean itself}

6c6adc4b-f1d2-4a2b-8526-f7a25522aa13.summary: Universal tendency towards balance as a supplementary assumption
6c6adc4b-f1d2-4a2b-8526-f7a25522aa13.content: {Human beings universally tend towards seeking balance in their actions and emotions}, {This universal tendency supports the idea that virtues represent a balanced state between extremes}, {Cultural variations represent different interpretations or applications of this underlying universal tendency}

3a7ca6cd-389a-489b-a85d-14b9d65e319d.summary: Rejecting intuition of cultural relativism undermining universality
3a7ca6cd-389a-489b-a85d-14b9d65e319d.content: {The intuition that differing cultural norms undermine a universal notion of virtue is mistaken}, {Cultural norms can reflect different means without challenging the universal principle of virtue as balance}, {Universality in the concept of virtue is not negated by specific cultural expressions of what counts as virtue}

6336a991-7072-4baa-831b-d05c98b3c38c.summary: Explaining cultural differences through the relativity of the mean
6336a991-7072-4baa-831b-d05c98b3c38c.content: {The mean is inherently relative to individual and cultural circumstances}, {This relativity is an intrinsic feature of the virtue as the mean, not a flaw}, {Different cultural manifestations of virtue reflect the adaptability and relativity of finding the mean, which is consistent within the theory}

aa0523b8-777a-44cf-a271-786dd267eaf7.content: {Virtue is the appropriate balance between excess and deficiency}, {The appropriate balance is determined by specific situational factors}, {Each virtue may manifest differently depending on context}

2c5d81b5-6279-4cf9-b81a-bec73ba0a1e0.content: {Virtues are distinct excellences of character that vary according to their own standards}, {The notion of mean is different for each virtue and not always equidistant between extremes}, {Excellence is assessed based on the intrinsic qualities of a virtue rather than its position between vices}

1526331f-458c-4aa6-bb8a-7c72abc67c58.content: {Virtue involves maintaining a dynamic equilibrium rather than a static mean}, {This equilibrium changes with shifting personal and environmental factors}, {The balance one seeks depends on a changing interplay of virtues and vices}

758dda42-70dd-4460-bbfd-2e3a99deba6e.content: {Virtue is defined by cultivating the best aspect of human character}, {Cultivation aims at optimal flourishing irrespective of mean}, {Different virtues may require starkly distinct forms of cultivation}

8ff9df1a-a91b-4f62-b892-7e69a007e706.content: {Virtue accommodates a diversity of character traits}, {Different character traits manifest as extremes in different contexts}, {Virtue is about harmony among traits rather than moderation}

957fa586-7326-48be-b7c3-9a983256b990.content: {Virtue is an adaptive response to varying life circumstances}, {The appropriateness of an extreme act depends on its adaptive success}, {Virtue involves the flexibility to act with excess or deficiency when necessary}

40b2b23b-3c8b-4399-be70-e75c62c16b67.content: {Virtue is the balance determined by context-sensitive criteria}, {The balance may require extremes under certain conditions}, {Virtue is assessed by whether actions fulfill their context-specific purpose}

ae130a7d-eacd-4179-ac26-b60f6304297c.content: {Virtue involves holistic judgment of actions}, {Holistic judgment considers consequences and intentions}, {Virtuous actions may be extreme if they align with holistic evaluation of good}

33e7404d-fe1a-4f3a-9e7c-f9e6eeb37015.content: {Virtue is the rational regulation of emotions}, {The rational regulation aims to achieve virtuous ends}, {Emotions may guide extreme actions when rationally justified}

e1c5d218-899b-4a8f-b06c-35b09e152824.content: {Virtue is acting with purpose towards good outcomes}, {The nature of the action is guided by its purpose not by moderation}, {Purpose can justify extremes if they fulfill virtuous goals}

e9552e5a-4260-432e-b8e8-985bae2d34cb.summary: Distinguishing between types of actions and contexts
e9552e5a-4260-432e-b8e8-985bae2d34cb.content: {There is a distinction between actions that are extreme in quantity and those that are contextually appropriate}, {The concept of the mean is relative to specific circumstances and needs}, {An action that seems extreme may actually embody the mean in a context requiring intensified response}, {What is virtuous depends not on the extremity but on its appropriateness to the situation}

7642231e-0ec9-4b5f-aead-c2458902e278.summary: Rejecting the broad categorization of virtue
7642231e-0ec9-4b5f-aead-c2458902e278.content: {The claim that all extreme actions cannot be virtuous is false}, {Virtue as the mean allows for situations where what appears extreme is a mean relative to us}, {The intuition that some extreme actions are virtuous rather than excessive can be explained by misidentifying where the true mean lies}

9712a4c3-5610-4cf8-b987-b7e39fe4c8a2.summary: Supplementing with a notion of heroic virtue
9712a4c3-5610-4cf8-b987-b7e39fe4c8a2.content: {The theory can incorporate a notion of heroic virtue, which might appear extreme but is actually a proper mean in extraordinary circumstances}, {Heroic virtue supplements traditional virtues without contradicting the original theory}, {Acts of extreme courage or kindness can be seen as fitting the mean in critical situations}

4a2eccab-af1b-41e3-ae84-6495ae30a1a2.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relative to the situation}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}, {In complex situations, context determines proper balance of virtues}

abae02df-b513-4753-b200-a7ed744a9523.content: {Virtue involves balancing between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relative to us}, {Complex moral situations involve integrating multiple virtues simultaneously}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

a6819815-3d4f-4b4c-a9d0-e818bc6b00b9.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relational to individual and societal context}, {Each virtue depends on a calibration among all relevant virtues}, {Complex moral situations require recalibrating virtuous actions contextually}

e3531cd9-fff3-4ca6-9c7d-5c90f3080976.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relative to personal and cultural factors}, {Each virtue's mean adjusts dynamically in complex scenarios}, {Complex moral situations involve flexible adjustment of virtue emphasis}

f75a5de0-ecf0-4df7-b290-ea24cca3c2b8.summary: Clarifying context dependency of the mean
f75a5de0-ecf0-4df7-b290-ea24cca3c2b8.content: {The mean between excess and deficiency is context-dependent, accommodating the complexity of varying situations.}, {In complex moral situations, the mean should be evaluated relative to the specifics of each situation, allowing multiple virtues to be balanced appropriately.}, {The theory of virtue as the mean involves flexibility to adjust to the demands of different contexts, preserving its relevance even in complex cases.}

b07881a8-1898-48cb-8ba3-3fbc57916098.summary: Reassessing the concept of virtue prioritization
b07881a8-1898-48cb-8ba3-3fbc57916098.content: {Prioritizing different virtues in moral dilemmas does not necessarily conflict with the mean concept.}, {Virtue as the mean can account for prioritizing different virtues by understanding the appropriate mean as determined by situational demands.}, {The theoretical intuition about virtue prioritization aligns with the mean when understood as contextually relevant balancing rather than a fixed middle path.}

5c09add4-b750-4254-a0fd-ce470ff6a3c0.summary: Incorporating practical wisdom for complex situations
5c09add4-b750-4254-a0fd-ce470ff6a3c0.content: {Practically applying virtue as the mean requires practical wisdom, or phronesis, to navigate complex moral situations.}, {Practical wisdom enables individuals to discern the right balance of virtues in each unique context.}, {The sufficiency of the mean is not challenged by complexity when practical wisdom is recognized as essential for determining the mean.}

76736322-9990-466a-9a5b-e7f82f30f633.content: {Virtue involves a balanced state that is not merely the arithmetic mean}, {The balance is a dynamic interplay rather than a fixed point}, {Each virtue maintains a harmony with respect to specific contexts}

50d6e132-590d-4d59-adc5-72228e6f4dcb.content: {Virtue is the mean determined by contextual factors}, {The context determines the boundaries of excess and deficiency}, {Each virtue is defined within a specific situational framework}

5d2ac4c7-5070-4ee7-8ab5-6bc3ff79cca2.content: {Virtue is the relational mean between personal capacities and external demands}, {The mean adapts to individual variations and context}, {Each virtue arises from an individual’s capacity to meet situational demands}

bdaa3b47-da38-4c45-a8b3-81e1d77d2ec2.content: {Virtue is defined by a range of acceptable behaviors rather than a single point}, {The range is influenced by social and cultural norms}, {Each virtue manifests differently across various situations}

4df777c5-8d33-4b8b-b02c-0a8e239a1001.content: {Virtue accounts for complexity in behavior rather than strict moderation}, {Complexity considers multiple factors like intentions and consequences}, {Each virtue involves integrating multiple perspectives}

86753174-f5db-48c7-b64c-0ee6cdac9213.content: {There is a distinction between theoretical precision and practical imperfection in determining boundaries.}, {Virtue as the mean is an ideal model for evaluating moral character and does not depend on precise lines between excess and deficiency.}, {In practice, pragmatic considerations determine where the mean lies relative to us, accommodating potential ambiguities.}, {The presence of ambiguous cases does not undermine the framework’s theoretical validity but reflects the complexity of moral decision-making.}

d556d21f-500a-4d1c-ae37-a8a5a0170b96.summary: Rejection of binary delineation as incomplete
d556d21f-500a-4d1c-ae37-a8a5a0170b96.content: {It is false that virtue as the mean requires a strictly binary distinction between excess and deficiency.}, {The concept of virtue as the mean allows for gradations within moral character evaluation.}, {The presence of intermediate cases enriches rather than challenges the virtue framework by acknowledging complexity in moral life.}

b544b3c3-73dd-49c7-b938-3d9c7907a2bf.content: {Moral virtue involves practical wisdom, which provides flexibility in judgment concerning excess and deficiency.}, {Practical wisdom allows an individual to discern the mean in context-sensitive ways, accommodating ambiguous cases.}, {This flexible judgment supports virtue as the mean, maintaining its applicability across various scenarios.}

8fa5988f-9868-4b6a-8bd0-72eea7293947.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is an objective standard}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

2fddc208-8e02-4518-b82f-85686cd3b3a0.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is relative to cultural norms}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

c3a9a512-a5bf-43a2-b36f-978982a8957f.summary: Virtue as the Mean with Expert Guidance
c3a9a512-a5bf-43a2-b36f-978982a8957f.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined with guidance from moral experts}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

ce3967d7-b5bb-47ec-aeae-06047701ebab.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined through rational deliberation}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

fc07982c-d0ab-411e-b663-898a4c78c29e.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is tested and verified through empirical evidence}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

715e41bb-bab4-4a5a-a60d-7de388924d84.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is universally applicable across different contexts}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

0927ef21-39e1-474c-af32-f596c2c10003.content: {Virtue is the mean between excess and deficiency}, {The mean is determined by an ideal observer free of biases}, {Each virtue has corresponding vices of excess and deficiency}

e4eb09c9-595b-43e5-b1f4-6bde487ab4dc.summary: Distinguishing subjectivity from objectivity in perception of the mean
e4eb09c9-595b-43e5-b1f4-6bde487ab4dc.content: {The perception of the mean involves both subjective understanding and objective standards}, {Virtue as the mean allows for personal differences while maintaining an objective aspect relevant to human flourishing}, {Cultural and personal influences shape initial perceptions but do not determine the objective reality of the virtue as a mean}

0c59d2a3-0505-4b22-8de1-caf96214e8e1.summary: Rejecting the necessity of complete objectivity
0c59d2a3-0505-4b22-8de1-caf96214e8e1.content: {It is mistaken to require complete objectivity in determining the mean for virtue}, {Personal biases provide a starting point for moral reflection and refinement}, {The dynamics of cultural upbringing aid in refining rather than completely determining the perception of the mean}

ff0de482-3c11-442e-be82-b451da4b0a91.summary: Adding normative guidance for determining the mean
ff0de482-3c11-442e-be82-b451da4b0a91.content: {A supplementary set of normative criteria can guide the determination of the mean}, {Applying practical wisdom aids in navigating between cultural biases and objective standards}, {The practice of reflective equilibrium helps harmonize personal intuitions with shared moral insights}

6a8ee34b-d4a4-49c3-9130-07b57870913f.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves manifesting virtues such as kindness and compassion}, {Moral standards are guided by contextual rational principles}, {Virtue may involve actions that deviate from established standards to achieve a greater moral good}

b6d9650e-ac54-40a2-9f85-45e8222ef916.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence is determined by the consequences of an action}, {An action is virtuous if it promotes overall well-being}, {Virtuous actions consider potential outcomes over strict adherence to standards}

816abea8-bfad-4549-89b7-f16721356395.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves the character of the agent}, {Virtuous actions are those emanating from a benevolent character}, {A virtuous agent prioritizes moral intentions over strict adherence to principles}

b4bb3da9-1768-4576-a26d-45bcf06af3f4.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence is aligned with human flourishing}, {Virtuous actions are evaluated by their contribution to a flourishing life}, {Actions that deviate from moral standards can be virtuous if they enhance human flourishing}

a085d913-3796-436e-9e8a-8043d73bcd2d.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves flexibility in moral decision-making}, {Virtuous actions can adjust to unique circumstances}, {Moral standards can be modified by rational evaluation of specific contexts}

9673ced8-8304-4062-9caf-7626ff6abd9a.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence is guided by moral intuition}, {Virtuous actions may rely on intuitive moral judgments}, {Moral intuitions can override established moral standards}

f141bcbb-d427-4faa-be91-e8989651c573.summary: Distinguish between principled and situational morality
f141bcbb-d427-4faa-be91-e8989651c573.content: {There is a distinction between adhering to general moral standards and acting according to situational moral demands}, {Virtue as moral excellence involves acting in accordance with situational moral demands when they take precedence over established standards}, {Acting with kindness and compassion in certain situations exemplifies the virtue of moral excellence by adhering to rational principles that account for context}

7b657183-8805-44a1-87a5-93b828b9e4b7.summary: Reject adherence to inflexible moral standards
7b657183-8805-44a1-87a5-93b828b9e4b7.content: {It is false that virtue requires strict adherence to unyielding moral standards in every situation}, {Moral excellence involves the ability to critically evaluate when established standards should be set aside in favor of a greater moral good}, {This capability to adapt moral judgment to context showcases moral excellence and thus does not contradict the concept of virtue}

bb84d7dc-2278-4ab0-8e12-0232b237bf18.summary: Supplement virtue with flexible moral judgment
bb84d7dc-2278-4ab0-8e12-0232b237bf18.content: {Moral standards should include principles of flexibility that allow for exceptions in extreme cases}, {The theory of virtue as moral excellence can incorporate flexible judgment to ensure moral actions align with both standards and exceptional circumstances}, {Lying to save a life is consistent with moral excellence when evaluated through a framework that permits exceptions for the sake of greater justice or compassion}

9b0269bb-c6d6-4771-91d7-ecebc5ee88d5.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves cultivating good character traits}, {Good character traits are developed through habitual actions that align with virtues}

487d26ff-26ee-4a92-b28d-abd977fc561d.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to social norms}, {Social norms are constructed through communal practices and histories}

ca0ae6cb-ad34-4889-bdc8-7e575c09c81c.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves responding emotionally to moral situations}, {Emotional responses are shaped by empathetic understanding and reflection}

ada27108-fa07-4af4-9dcf-77eff007ecde.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves rationality contextualized to specific situations}, {Rationality in moral situations involves balancing emotions, context, and reason}

63cfb4e3-43b1-4cdb-901a-a9b68accffe4.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves living in harmony with nature}, {Living in harmony with nature means aligning one's life with natural processes and relationships}

31939144-7461-4aef-ad94-82bac655bae1.summary: Distinguishing between rational and non-rational moral standards
31939144-7461-4aef-ad94-82bac655bae1.content: {There is a distinction between moral actions guided by rational principles and those motivated by non-rational factors}, {Virtue as moral excellence emphasizes adherence to rational principles as a distinct category from emotions}, {Moral intuitions and emotional responses can be manifestations of underlying rational principles not immediately apparent}

67a0907f-3c57-4b03-a178-10c89ec71b3b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of emotional responses for virtuous actions
67a0907f-3c57-4b03-a178-10c89ec71b3b.content: {It is mistaken to claim that virtue depends primarily on emotional responses}, {Moral excellence involves prioritizing rational principles even when emotions and intuitions guide behaviors}, {Instances where emotional responses lead to virtuous actions also involve implicit rational underpinnings}

58f5cc46-5b47-431e-b6c4-8a03c5084cca.summary: Supplementing with the role of moral training in aligning emotions with reason
58f5cc46-5b47-431e-b6c4-8a03c5084cca.content: {Moral training can align emotional responses with rational moral standards}, {The cultivation of virtue involves harmonizing emotional intuitions with rational principles through moral education}, {Emotionally-driven virtuous actions reflect the internalization of rational moral standards via training}

f0daca8f-43f8-4926-874e-1d9070baf958.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by cultural principles}

0845ced2-2bea-4818-8284-80c55735091c.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by rational principles contextual to each culture}

c7ef710d-9544-41c5-a4d6-1ad2d33746f7.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adherence to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by the practical wisdom of the individual}

d9a7581c-b220-4f3e-8be4-5a24df7a7172.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by a balanced consideration of competing rational principles}

ccf04e3d-7617-4506-9e15-a815f59ad3c9.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by universally empathetic principles}

c77ddc53-5196-4523-9c60-dda9075f5d4f.content: {The term 'rational principles' can be understood as universal principles that may manifest in culturally specific ways}, {The core of rational principles is universal, while the application may vary across different cultures}, {These variations in application do not conflict with the universality of rational principles themselves}, {The universality of rational principles lies in fundamental moral truths rather than their expression}

8f2a834d-15b1-4cfd-a004-c0ba601e589b.content: {It is mistaken to conclude that variations in rational principles across cultures imply non-universality}, {The fundamental structure of rational principles is not dependent on cultural differences}, {Cultural differences reflect diverse interpretations rather than a lack of universal rationality}, {The essence of moral standards remains context-independent despite varying cultural applications}

c72b8458-9886-4de2-9729-0d201311b045.summary: Supplementing with interpretive bridging across cultures
c72b8458-9886-4de2-9729-0d201311b045.content: {A supplementary assumption is that rational principles necessitate interpretive bridging to be effectively understood across cultures}, {Rational principles act as a guide, while interpretation considers the cultural context}, {This interpretive bridging allows for the valid application of universal principles without sacrificing their essence}, {Such a supplement respects cultural distinctions while maintaining the universality of moral excellence}

875e0d23-cf2a-4dc3-b05b-908374dbf9eb.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves developing rational and ethical capacities}, {Rational and ethical capacities are determined by deliberative reasoning about moral principles}

ad0a6808-b299-469f-9331-8bab0895f6cd.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves progress towards moral ideals}, {Moral ideals are determined through critical reflection and ethical inquiry}

04a4f08e-ef72-4743-b0b1-3432944879b5.content: {There is a distinction between established norms and rational moral principles.}, {Virtue requires adherence to rational moral principles rather than societal norms.}, {Challenging unjust societal norms can be an expression of virtue if it aligns with rational moral principles.}, {Historical figures who defied norms may be virtuous for upholding principles that better align with moral excellence.}

e0eb2b49-e3e3-4ef3-8dfa-d211b84fe361.summary: Virtue as reinterpretation of moral standards.
e0eb2b49-e3e3-4ef3-8dfa-d211b84fe361.content: {Moral standards can evolve through rational critique and reflection.}, {Virtue involves the pursuit of moral excellence according to rational principles.}, {Civil disobedience can be virtuous when it instigates the re-evaluation and improvement of rational moral standards.}, {Challenging established norms can lead to a reinterpretation of what constitutes true moral excellence.}

b3092c02-086a-49f1-9980-a736b8298ac2.summary: Understanding virtue through higher moral laws.
b3092c02-086a-49f1-9980-a736b8298ac2.content: {There is a distinction between societal norms and higher moral laws determined by reason.}, {Virtue is about adhering to higher moral laws rather than established societal norms.}, {Acts of civil disobedience can be virtuous if they reflect adherence to higher moral laws.}, {Virtuous figures historically have often been those who adhered to higher laws in defiance of unjust norms.}

322ee27f-ba3a-4d75-8a6b-ec8271c8582d.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves inherently valuing moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by rational principles}, {Moral virtue requires an internal commitment to these standards beyond mere external adherence}

fbb3b2d7-8ab1-4d32-b139-fe75507f65b1.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves a disposition to act in accordance with moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by rational principles}, {A disposition to act requires a genuine commitment that aligns with moral goodness}

0bac11b0-a297-4768-8d41-752833edbc0b.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves an integrated orientation towards the good}, {Moral standards are established by rational principles}, {An integrated orientation combines internal commitment and external adherence}

a2a226ba-84c9-495f-a5bf-9322083aaed1.content: {There is a distinction between virtue and mere compliance with moral standards.}, {Moral excellence is inherent to virtue and involves an internal commitment to moral good beyond external adherence.}, {Virtue requires adherence to moral standards driven by rational principles and internal motivation, not just for outward benefits.}

642cc413-ea63-4483-a42e-e173951db530.content: {Virtue involves intrinsic motivation, not just external conformity to moral standards.}, {A person aiming for moral excellence has motivation grounded in rational principles and moral understanding.}, {Selfish reasons for adhering to standards lack the intrinsic commitment required for virtue.}

a0e101c9-ec7f-4531-be0f-a9b877f4ea4c.summary: Supplementing with the role of character
a0e101c9-ec7f-4531-be0f-a9b877f4ea4c.content: {Virtue is closely connected to character, which is not merely about actions but about dispositions and intentions.}, {Moral excellence is manifested in a person's character and their genuine commitment to acting ethically.}, {External actions may follow moral standards without achieving virtue if the intentions and character are misaligned with moral goodness.}

f24a1e6d-e915-4c1a-af7c-bb0feccce73f.summary: Virtue as Moral Excellence with Emotional Integration
f24a1e6d-e915-4c1a-af7c-bb0feccce73f.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by a combination of rational principles and an understanding of human emotions}

ea582dda-170b-49ec-bfd9-24cb20d23621.summary: Virtue as Moral Excellence with Social Context
ea582dda-170b-49ec-bfd9-24cb20d23621.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by rational principles informed by social contexts}

8b89b1f1-73c8-4fa3-ae70-554351950909.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to a plurality of moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by an integration of rational principles, emotions, and social context}

e68c8d14-461c-4068-890c-b869d8665980.summary: Virtue as Moral Excellence with Intrinsic Values
e68c8d14-461c-4068-890c-b869d8665980.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by rational principles recognizing intrinsic human values}

41aa6dd1-f11d-4bb5-82f8-e65d6c71e1c0.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by rational reflection that incorporates societal norms and emotional insights}

fc65f70d-37a6-41d0-b297-b63111c9840b.summary: Distinguishing between rational principles and practical wisdom
fc65f70d-37a6-41d0-b297-b63111c9840b.content: {There is a distinction between rational principles and practical wisdom.}, {Virtue as moral excellence incorporates practical wisdom beyond mere rational principles.}, {Practical wisdom considers human emotions and social context as part of moral reasoning.}, {Moral excellence requires the integration of rational principles with emotional and social understanding.}

632d02c6-5557-4c97-80fd-23c2f7255778.summary: Rejecting the necessity of emotional complexities in moral reasoning
632d02c6-5557-4c97-80fd-23c2f7255778.content: {It is false that rational principles necessarily overlook human emotions.}, {Rational principles can be formulated to include human emotions and social context within moral reasoning.}, {Moral standards can be consistently rational without excluding emotional and social factors.}

3fbc22cc-e75f-431a-b0f0-ea4497976cd0.summary: Supplementing rational principles with empathetic understanding
3fbc22cc-e75f-431a-b0f0-ea4497976cd0.content: {Empathetic understanding is a supplementary assumption to rational principles within moral excellence.}, {Empathetic understanding complements rational principles by incorporating emotional and social elements.}, {The integration of empathy with rationality strengthens the determination of moral standards.}

910279fe-4d2c-4a54-a7b0-4769738a0630.summary: Moral Grounding in Both Emotion and Reason
910279fe-4d2c-4a54-a7b0-4769738a0630.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by both rational principles and emotional insights}

54a26ec2-ed8c-4cd4-a234-6e9bc522517c.summary: Cultural and Rational Synthesis in Moral Standards
54a26ec2-ed8c-4cd4-a234-6e9bc522517c.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by a synthesis of rational principles and cultural norms}

d561e058-c52c-4cb0-b9d5-ba14f2a8d592.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are determined by a plurality of factors, including rationality, emotion, and cultural context}

6f713536-f955-434d-be39-b9e16bd15344.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to moral standards}, {Moral standards are context-dependent and include rational principles, emotions, and cultural values}

7c891849-249a-4e7d-a077-37ef70bb0ef7.summary: Distinguishing rational and contextual moral standards
7c891849-249a-4e7d-a077-37ef70bb0ef7.content: {There is a distinction between rational moral standards and contextual moral standards.}, {Virtue as moral excellence is concerned with rational moral standards.}, {Traditionally held moral standards can be contextually driven, but this does not undermine the rational nature of moral excellence described in the theory.}

7355551b-df76-4b64-9c30-30e7733e1626.summary: Rejecting the necessity of purely rational standards
7355551b-df76-4b64-9c30-30e7733e1626.content: {It is mistaken to think that moral standards must be solely rational to be valid.}, {Emotional or cultural contexts do not automatically invalidate the moral excellence of a standard.}, {Rational principles can accommodate the integration of emotion and culture within moral standards while maintaining their excellence.}

86a79fe7-e470-46fa-9c3a-c8dedff8b649.content: {Moral standards can incorporate contextual elements while still adhering to rational principles.}, {Rational analysis can be applied within cultural and emotional contexts to determine moral excellence.}, {The theory of virtue as moral excellence can accommodate these contextual influences without losing its rational foundation.}

e825dc45-0580-43ed-9612-0e87448dd9c4.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves responding appropriately to particular contexts}, {Moral standards are determined by practical reasoning in specific situations}

3515ceda-c68a-4b1d-854a-cce4d3242dc0.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves a balance among multiple virtues}, {Moral standards are determined by an integration of different virtues, each relevant to varying situations}

94bdba82-7034-4916-b672-861fe489fa72.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves acting in accordance with the needs of the situation}, {Moral standards are determined by the requirements of specific circumstances}

de0cd7e2-271d-4027-8e46-0dba7ab35dad.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adherence to an individual's moral intuition}, {Moral standards are determined by the personal moral character of the individual}

6cac2eee-73bc-4cde-adb8-e9e43c9342d3.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves achieving the best practical outcomes}, {Moral standards are determined by practical considerations and consequences}

1333a47a-fece-4729-a6de-4cdfa5a3ab27.summary: Distinction between prima facie and actual moral standards
1333a47a-fece-4729-a6de-4cdfa5a3ab27.content: {There is a distinction between prima facie moral standards and actual moral standards}, {Prima facie moral standards are initial guidelines subject to overriding principles in specific contexts}, {Virtue as moral excellence adheres to actual moral standards, which consider context and rational deliberation}, {The appearance of conflict arises when prima facie standards are mistaken for actual standards}

7bf70539-3ebc-409a-b071-240973cf8ab8.content: {Virtues involve context-sensitive moral reasoning that integrates different moral considerations}, {Adhering to moral standards through virtues requires balancing multiple concerns, sometimes modifying standard rules}, {The virtue of care does not conflict with moral standards, but rather reflects nuanced moral judgement}

e19a2122-068f-4bd8-80c8-2b7ebd818c15.summary: Supplementary assumption of hierarchical moral standards
e19a2122-068f-4bd8-80c8-2b7ebd818c15.content: {Moral standards operate hierarchically, with some standards taking precedence over others in conflicts}, {Virtue as moral excellence includes understanding this hierarchy and acting accordingly}, {Confidentiality and care might conflict, but care may be the higher moral standard in situations of imminent harm}

9c5d7cdc-8ea4-4e41-ac50-c5ef4a178cf7.content: {Virtue is a fundamental moral disposition}, {Moral dispositions contribute to moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves aligning character with moral dispositions}

dd4d9fe8-48b8-418e-b19e-2ca9daf83815.content: {Virtue is a form of character strength}, {Character strength contributes to moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves developing and maintaining strong moral character}

c1c75be5-57e3-4667-a7a0-7d34f9967750.content: {Virtue is a form of moral integrity}, {Moral integrity contributes to moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves consistent alignment with one's moral values}

b5cf685b-1ff8-42a6-a095-f3b605723837.content: {Virtue is an ideal moral aspiration}, {Ideal aspirations guide one towards moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves striving to embody moral ideals}

a6ae0f9f-3173-47b7-a89b-0ccf06571b85.content: {Virtue is an ethical commitment}, {Ethical commitments foster moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves unwavering commitment to ethical principles}

4fc92f72-98ad-4d60-aaf4-4c6455640bd2.content: {Virtue is a state of psychological harmony}, {Psychological harmony contributes to moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves achieving congruence among one's desires, beliefs, and actions}

bb3528b3-0cc9-4030-bdcc-297505a11bd0.content: {Virtue is a form of rational excellence}, {Rational excellence leads to moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves exercising rational judgment in moral contexts}

f07d9c8c-e2b8-4b65-84cd-cfaa3482baab.content: {Virtue acts as an internal moral compass}, {The internal moral compass guides toward moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves following one's internal moral compass}

1975a3c1-8be5-4f68-8dd4-14dfa7eba2fd.content: {Virtue is part of a consistent ethical framework}, {A consistent ethical framework ensures moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to a consistent set of ethical values}

024cb25c-b615-4a70-9836-a8a49aa05dff.content: {Virtue involves emotionally informed rationality}, {Emotionally informed rationality enhances moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves integrating emotion and reason into moral decision-making}

4704b612-5f97-4fe7-a51a-6e588fc01143.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external manifestations of virtue
4704b612-5f97-4fe7-a51a-6e588fc01143.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external manifestations of virtue.}, {Virtue as moral excellence primarily concerns internal adherence to moral standards determined by rational principles.}, {The presence of a virtue in character does not require constant external expression in actions to maintain moral excellence.}, {Virtues that are internalized are consistent with moral excellence even when not actively displayed.}, {The intuition that virtue must always be action-oriented confuses external display with internal moral commitment.}

7a5fc2b9-86f0-494c-a888-9ab67dc48f3e.summary: Rejecting the necessity of action for moral excellence
7a5fc2b9-86f0-494c-a888-9ab67dc48f3e.content: {The assumption that moral excellence must always be evidenced by action is false.}, {A person can possess a virtuous trait, such as patience, without needing to constantly act on it to be morally excellent.}, {Moral excellence is determined by adherence to rational moral principles irrespective of continuous action.}, {The non-manifestation of virtues in particular actions does not undermine moral excellence as defined by virtue ethics.}

102e88ee-f432-4821-ba71-1a487fe65af5.summary: Explaining the role of supplementary rational principles
102e88ee-f432-4821-ba71-1a487fe65af5.content: {The role of rational principles is supplementary in defining and recognizing virtue as moral excellence.}, {These principles allow us to recognize virtues that are not immediately observable in actions.}, {Moral excellence involves an internalized commitment to these rational principles, which does not always mandate visible actions.}, {The absence of observable actions does not detract from the rationally defined moral excellence of internalized virtues.}, {Understanding moral excellence as rational conditionally acknowledges virtues not constantly displayed in action.}

7a8989ec-bca5-4187-805a-bbe0ea9093d0.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to objective moral standards}, {Objective moral standards are determined by universal rational principles}

98e615ae-3aa6-4505-868c-e7ebcf530dbd.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to culturally relative moral standards}, {Culturally relative moral standards are determined by the rational principles relevant to the culture}

923fe6ab-cba1-4b70-9f39-a307c7b92629.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to practical moral standards}, {Practical moral standards are determined by rational principles that promote societal well-being}

853a9745-ff61-4469-a64b-73ff936cfa35.content: {Virtue is a form of moral excellence}, {Moral excellence involves adhering to evolving moral standards}, {Evolving moral standards are revisited and modified by rational principles}
